subject: p11052273
Findings: AP and lateral views of the chest. Thereis hyperinflation, consistent with background COPD. There is increased diffuse parenchymal opacities bilaterally, more prominent at the bases consistent with mild pulmonary edema. There are small bilateral pleural effusions layering posteriorly, left greater than right. There is fluid in the major fissure seen on the lateral view. There is moderate cardiomegaly. No pneumothorax. The left hemidiaphragm is elevated laterally.
Impression: Moderate cardiomegaly, mild pulmonary edema and small bilateral pleural effusions consistent with CHF.
